Description
The client is seeking a Lead Engineer, Data & Analytics to join our Information Technology team and collaborate with a supportive and innovative group of technology and business professionals. This role will serve as a critical player in upholding our commitment to excellence through leadership over our data platform, engineering & analytics disciplines.

Our ideal candidate is a strategic thinker and exceptional leader who is passionate about using data to enable successful business outcomes. Your expertise will be essential in spearheading the design, development, and implementation of our evolving data infrastructure. You will lead a team of engineers, architecting scalable solutions to collect, process, and analyze data, ultimately driving critical business decisions and maximizing operational efficiency. For the right person, we will consider a remote working arrangement.


Review, recommend, and implement solutions for optimizing data and database operations, taking into consideration design, configuration, reporting, performance, replication, high availability, fault tolerance, and storage
Develop and optimize ETL/ELT pipelines
Identify and mitigate performance and scalability issues in various data environments
Design optimized, efficient, reliable, and cost-effective cloud-native data platforms
Implement data lake and data warehouse architectures that support business objectives
Develop, maintain, and document data models that transform application data into actionable reporting and analysis assets (dashboards, operational scorecards, etc.)
Gather requirements for and lead the development of new reports, dashboards, and similar database objects
Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in cloud data platforms and recommend relevant changes to our data platforms and analytics processes and approaches
Monitor and perform frequent analysis and any necessary remediation of cloud data platforms for risk management, tuning/sizing, cost management, disaster recovery, and capacity planning
Address and resolve database and data platform technical debt
Analyze data access patterns and tune indexes, constraints, foreign keys, queries, etc.
All other job duties and responsibilities as assigned

Requirements


Extensive experience collaborating with development teams in helping them achieve reliable, scalable, performant, and secure data solutions
Experience in database security, backup & recovery, architecture, networking, and administration
Ability to develop a strong partnership with technology teams and customers to understand business needs and with advanced skills to communicate solutions in business terms
Strong performance tuning skills with the ability to identify, respond and resolve database performance issues
Expertise in SQL and proficiency in at least 1 additional programming language, such as Python or R
Experience with reporting platforms such as Tableau, PowerBI, or similar.
Experience with cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake, Redshift, or BigQuery that rely on Multiple Parallel Processing
Capacity to apply critical thinking and an analytical mindset to solve problems
Excellent communication skills


7+ years experience in database engineering or related field
Expertise and deep understanding in database replication setup, configuration, and troubleshooting
Data or cloud provider certifications (Microsoft, AWS, Snowflake, Tableau, Google, etc.)
Agile framework expertise

7 years

Overview:
We are seeking a Sr Data Engineer who will be responsible for the development and maintenance of both batch and real-time data ingestion platforms, ensuring the provision of reliable datasets that empower stakeholders to make informed and timely decisions supporting customer activities. The role also encompasses fostering a culture of excellence within a high-performing data engineering team, with the support of third-party development partners.

In this role, you will also be tasked with enhancing the architecture of our Microsoft Azure-based data warehouse, designed specifically for reporting and business intelligence. This includes integrating with externally hosted COTs products and leveraging existing Operational Data Store (ODS) structures, such as , to facilitate seamless data management and accessibility. You will lead the design, development, and maintenance of our business intelligence solutions, utilizing Microsoft's suite of tools and technologies. This position demands a collaborative approach, working closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design data models, and implement scalable BI solutions that support and propel our business objectives forward.

Job_Title: Sr Engineer, Data Integrations and Analytics
Job_Description:
Description:
Now is the time to join PDS Health. You will have opportunities to learn new skills from our team of experienced professionals. If you're ready to take your career to the next level and gain valuable experience, apply today!
Overview:
The primary role of the Sr Engineer, Data Integrations & Analytics, is to work within our Accounting & Finance team to develop and support technical aspects of Oracle Fusion Cloud (ERP/EPM/EDM) such as OIC Integrations, ESS Jobs, Configurations, Rest & Soap calls, API's, FBDI Loads, BIP reports, and BICC. You’ll be responsible for all aspects of designing technical solutions, debugging and resolving data issues as well as developing solutions based on specifications. This position will monitor and tune performance of interfaces between Oracle Fusion Cloud and external applications (Workday, Epic, Concur, etc.). You will help provide production support for Fusion Cloud (ERP/EPM/EDM) and responsible for ensuring SDLC procedures are followed when making changes to the system. You will work directly with business users to support and design solutions involving writing technical specifications and requirements for integrations, enhancements, and creating custom reports.The Sr Engineer, Data Integrations & Analytics should have a positive attitude and excellent communication skills and be committed to achieving predetermined goals and deadlines while working within the policies of the Accounting Department.








Salary Information: $107,088.00-$180,169.00 / Annually

Job_Title: Senior Data Engineer for Training Curriculum
Job_Description:
The MinIO team is looking for an experienced Data Engineer with at least five years of designing, deploying and supporting high-performance, large-scale processing systems and data pipelines using GPU processors. The candidate must be well rounded, with experience with modern workloads such as AI/ML platforms, data lakehouses, modern database technologies (MongoDB, Snowflake, Vector), open table formats (Iceberg, Deltalake, Hudi).
You will work closely with the MinIO Engineering team to understand how to optimize MinIO object storage for these workloads. This research will lead to the development of training content, including hands-on labs and course materials. You will be recording videos that will be published on YouTube and the future MinIO learning portal.
You will be part of a team of technologists, video editors, and motion graphic designers building a world-class training portfolio for MinIO. This role works hand in hand with MinIO engineering, support, and technical marketing to tell the Kubernetes-native, multi-cloud story that is MinIO object storage as it relates to the data store.
